footer.description: Torghatten Marathon was first held in 2015 and is organized annually on the last weekend of April. The race takes place in scenic surroundings on the Torg√∏yan islands in Br√∏nn√∏y municipality.

barnelop.description: Fun race for children On Nordhus Stadium
barnelop.certified: This course is not officially certified.
barnelop.description1: A safe and fun race designed specifically for children.
barnelop.description2:
The children‚Äôs race is a short distance that everyone can complete, with or without assistance. 
 There are two laps around Nordhus Stadium, and the children finish at the same location as participants in the other distances. 
 There is always a great atmosphere at Nordhus, with children being cheered on by family and others. If any of the children need help to complete the race, that is of course perfectly fine. 
 All participants receive a medal at the finish line. 

 NB! Registration can also be done directly at the race office. Please allow sufficient time!.

halvmaraton.description: Half marathon distance through a scenic landscape
halvmaraton.certified: This course is officially certified and measured.
halvmaraton.description1: Experience the perfect balance of challenge and scenery.
halvmaraton.description2:
The half marathon course is the same as the full marathon course (x 0.5). It starts and finishes at Nordhus Stadium. 
 The course is run on asphalt in scenic surroundings along the coastline of the Torg Islands. Parts of the course also follow gravel roads around the legendary Torghatten mountain, offering a unique nature experience. 
 
 Overall, this is a relatively flat course with gentle undulations. 
 The start area is approximately 8 meters above sea level, and the highest point on the course is reached after about 12.5 km, at approximately 32 meters above sea level. 
 The course starts flat/downhill, followed by a 6-meter climb after 200 meters. This is followed by fairly flat terrain for about 11.5 km, then a gradual climb of 27 meters over approximately 1 km to the highest point, before descending and flattening out towards the finish.
halvmaraton.videoDescription: View the half marathon course, and join and take part.

helmaraton.description: The ultimate challenge - full marathon distance in breathtaking surroundings.
helmaraton.certified: This course is officially certified and measured.
helmaraton.description1: The crown jewel of Torghatten Marathon - 42.195 km of pure adventure.
helmaraton.description2:
The full marathon course is the same as the half marathon course (x 2). It starts and finishes at Nordhus Stadium. 
 The course is run on asphalt in scenic surroundings along the coastline of the Torg Islands. Parts of the course also follow gravel roads around the legendary Torghatten mountain, offering a unique nature experience. 
 
 Overall, this is a relatively flat course with gentle undulations. 
 The start area is approximately 8 meters above sea level, and the highest point on the course is reached after about 12.5 km, at approximately 32 meters above sea level. 
 The course starts flat/downhill, followed by a 6-meter climb after 200 meters. This is followed by fairly flat terrain for about 11.5 km, then a gradual climb of 27 meters over approximately 1 km to the highest point, before descending and flattening out towards the finish.
helmaraton.videoDescription: View the full marathon course, and join and take part.

minimaraton.description: Shorter distance perfect for beginners or those wanting a lighter challenge.
minimaraton.certified: This course is not officially certified.
minimaraton.description1: A great introduction to distance running in beautiful surroundings.
minimaraton.description2:
The Minimarathon partly follows the same course as √òygaloppen. The course starts at Nordhus School and runs downhill towards Toft. 
 At Solvang Toft Youth Center, the course turns right onto the cycle path. The cycle path is followed down towards the Aquaculture Center at Toft, before continuing along the main road back to the finish line at Nordhus Stadium.
minimaraton.videoDescription: View the mini marathon course, and join and take part.

oygaloppen.description: 10 km race on Nordhus and a loop out to Toft.
oygaloppen.certified: This course is officially certified and measured.
oygaloppen.description1: √òygaloppen follows the same course as the S√∏r-Helgeland Running Series, where the long-standing race carries the same name.
oygaloppen.description2:
The course starts at Nordhus School and follows the paved road towards Torghatten, with the turnaround point located on the final hill before Torgvatnan. 
On the return, the route passes Nordhus School and continues downhill towards Toft. At Solvang Toft Youth Center, the course turns right onto the cycle path. 
The cycle path is followed down towards the Aquaculture Center at Toft, before rejoining the main road back to the finish line at Nordhus Stadium.
oygaloppen.videoDescription: View the island race course, and join and take part.

paralop.description: Accessible race for participants with disabilities.
paralop.certified: This course is not officially certified.
paralop.description1: An inclusive race designed for all abilities.
paralop.description2:
The Para Race is for people with disabilities ‚Äì of all ages, from 0 to 100 years! 
 Participants in the Para Race complete one or two laps around Nordhus Stadium and finish at the same location as the other distances. All assistive devices and guides are allowed. 
 There is always a great atmosphere and strong support from spectators around Nordhus Stadium on race day. 
 All participants receive a medal when they cross the finish line.

trim.description: Recreational fitness activity for all ages and abilities.
trim.certified: This is a recreational activity, not officially certified.
trim.description1: Join our community fitness activity in beautiful natural surroundings.
trim.description2:
You do not have to run for time, and you are also welcome to walk or roll. That is why we have set up a fitness walk route along the same course as √òygaloppen and the Minimarathon. 

 Bring family and friends for an outing in beautiful surroundings at Nordhus and Toft, along walking and cycling paths and sidewalks, while cheering on the runners in √òygaloppen and the Minimarathon. 

 NB! Start numbers are used, but without timing chips. 

 The course starts at Nordhus School and runs downhill towards Toft. 

 At Solvang Toft Youth Center, the course turns right onto the cycle path. The cycle path is followed down towards the Aquaculture Center at Toft, before continuing along the main road back to the finish line at Nordhus Stadium. 

 NB! Registration can also be done directly at the race office. Please allow plenty of time!
trim.videoDescription: The course is the same as the Mini Marathon and is suitable for everyone.

helgelandslopene.title: Helgeland Races 2025
helgelandslopene.lead: Helgeland Races 2025 features five great events across the Helgeland region. If you participate in at least four out of five races, you earn a special T-shirt and an engraved plate. You also enter the draw for NOK 5,000. Distances must be 10 km or longer. The following races are included:

runs.name: Torghatten Marathon ‚Äì Saturday 26 April
runs.desc: Run in stunning scenery around the legendary mountain outside Br√∏nn√∏ysund. Distances from 3.6 to 42.2 km, with certified 10 km, half and full marathon courses. Includes a kids‚Äô race and para race.

runs.name: S√∏mnamile ‚Äì Saturday 24 May
runs.desc: S√∏mna IL has a long tradition of distance running. S√∏mnamile continues this with certified 5 km and 10 km races, plus a 650 m kids‚Äô race. Expect a friendly Saturday at S√∏mna stadium!

runs.name: Alstahaug Marathon ‚Äì Saturday 14 June
runs.desc: A legendary race since 1982. Certified distances of 5, 10, 21 and 42.2 km. The marathon starts in Sandnessj√∏en; all distances finish at beautiful Tj√∏tta g√•rd.

runs.name: Mil√¶ ‚Äì Saturday 16 August
runs.desc: A vibrant city-centre race on flat courses through Mosj√∏en, hosted by Vefsn municipality and Helgeland Kraft sports clubs. Distances: kids‚Äô race, 5 km and 10 km. In 2025 the race is part of the Helgeland Kraft Energy Games at Kippermoen, including the Norwegian pole climbing championships!

runs.name: Nesna Running Festival ‚Äì Saturday 20 September
runs.desc: First held in 2023 with over 400 participants. Choose between half marathon, 10 km and 5 km (all certified). Also includes a 5 km untimed option and a kids‚Äô race ‚Äì aiming for a festive community atmosphere.

about.subtitle: Sport Torghatten IL and the story behind Torghatten Marathon
about.pageDescription: Read about Sport Torghatten IL who organizes Torghatten Marathon, our history since 2015 and our commitment to running and fitness.
about.organizerText: Torghatten Marathon is organized by Sport Torghatten IL, which is located on Torg√∏ya island in Br√∏nn√∏y municipality.
about.traditionText: Sport Torghatten has a long tradition of organizing races and fitness activities, and has gathered distances in this event that suit everyone regardless of ambition, age or level.
about.historyText: Torghatten Marathon was first organized in 2015, after enthusiasts got the whole thing started. Since then we have gained experience and learned, more enthusiasts have joined, the local community supports us, and together we have become quite good at organizing.
about.welcomeText: The race event is intended for everyone who enjoys running and fitness, not just locals, but also visitors from home and abroad, and everyone who wants to be spectators.
about.feedbackText: We receive incredibly many positive feedbacks from participants, both regarding the event itself and especially the beautiful nature experience that the distances invite to.
about.collaborationText: We are fortunate to have these nature experiences here with us, but without sponsors, volunteers and enthusiasts, it would not be possible to organize Torghatten Marathon. If you want to contribute, don't hesitate to contact us.
about.qualityText: We know it's important for participants that distances are correct and that timing and results are accurate. Therefore, most distances in the event are certified. And we use hired professional timers (from EQ Timing), with top modern timing equipment.
about.contactText: We would like you to contact us (phone, email or speak directly with us), if you have opinions, suggestions or tips (positive or negative). We are more than receptive and gladly accept input, so we can make even better arrangements, so that Torghatten Marathon becomes a positive experience for everyone.
